sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Christopher Angell, a Grecian, who tasted of many stripes and torments inflicted by the Turkes for the faith which he had in Iesus Christ. Angelus, Christophorus, d. 1638.
[16] p. : ill.
Printed by Iohn Lichfield, and Iames Short, Printers to the famous Vniversitie, At Oxford, : 1618..
Attributed to Christophorus Angelus. Cf. STC (2nd ed.). Printer's device on t.p., initials, headpieces. Signatures: A-B⁴. Reproduction of original in: Bodleian Library.
=======
